GameDBLocalizedString.Text: แผนกวณวิทยา DLC
แผนกวณวิทยา
หน่วยรักษาบาดแผลไหม้
รักษาผู้ป่วยที่แผนกรักษาแผลไหม้อย่างใกล้ชัด\n\nRequired room: Burn unit
หน่วยไฟไหม้น้ำร้อนลวก
หน่วยนี้สามารถรักษาบาดแผลไหม้ได้
ห้องวณวิทยา
คลินิกผู้ป่วยนอกถูกใช้เพื่อตรวจสอบและรักษาเบื้องต้น ต้องการพนักงาน:\n1x นักวณวิทยา
หน่วยวินิจฉัย

หน่วยวินิจฉัยที่ประจำอยู่ที่แผนกวณวิทยาจะคอยทำหน้าที่ตรวจสอบและรักษาผู้ป่วยในโรงพยาบาล 

Min. Staff requirements: 
1x Traumatologist 
(Personnel based in On-call room)
หน่วยตรวจคลื่นหัวใจ
วณวิทยา
นักวณวิทยามีหน้าที่รักษาบา่ดแผลเฉียบพลันทางกายภาพ
ศัลยศาสตร์อุบัติเหตุ
ศัลยแพทย์อุบัติเหตุมีหน้าที่ผ่าตัดบาดแผลที่ซับซ้อน
เฮลิคอปเตอร์
เฮลิคอปเตอร์
เฮลิคอปเตอร์
เฮลิคอปเตอร์จะทำผู้ป่วยที่บาดเจ็บหนักเข้ารักษา
ไฟลานจอดเฮลิคอปเตอร์
ไฟลานจอดเฮลิคอปเตอร์
ไฟลานจอดเฮลิคอปเตอร์
ไฟลานจอดเฮลิคอปเตอร์ตคอยส่องแสงสว่างเพื่อให้เฮลิคอปเตอร์ลงจอดตอนกลางคืนได้
ตู้เก็บอุปกรณ์ - สูง
โปสเตอร์ - อบัติเหตุ
โปสเตรอ์ - บริจาคเลือด
จอแสดงชีพจร - กำแพง
เครื่องมือสำหรับบาดแผล
เป็นเซ็ตเครื่องมือสำหนับหน่วยวณวิทยา
ตู้เก็บอุปกรณ์
Bed socket
หน่วยไฟไหม้น้ำร้อนลวก
ตู้ข้างเตียง
เตียงผู้ป่วยแบบไฮเท็ค
เตียงที่มีรางด้านข้างเป็นกระจก
สามารถวางได้แค่ชั้นที่ลิฟต์เข้าถึงได้เท่านั้น
ไม่สามารถวางใต้ชั้นอื่นได้
แม่แบบของห้องแผนกวณวิทยา
ถนนสีขาว
ถนนสีเหลือง
Road with yellow line
Road with wide white line
Road with wide yellow line
Warning lines
Warning lines
Police officer
Firefighter
An armed robbery followed by a shootout in the streets in the city center has just been reported. All suspects were apprehended and emergency services are transporting wounded to nearby hospitals.

A high-rise building has caught fire in a residential city district. Firefighters and police surrounded the tower and are evacuating the residents. Your hospital should prepare for a high number of burn injuries.
An explosion followed by a fire has been reported in a local power plant. All emergency services are already on site and transporting wounded to nearby hospitals.

A terrorist attack just happened at the local airport. The police have closed whole area, but there is still lot of dead and wounded people. Ambulances have started transporting the heaviest injuries to the closest hospitals.
A high-speed police pursuit of a hijacked armored truck ended in a hail of gunfire, leaving wounded people all around the area.

Fire crews are battling a massive wildfire that has forced thousands of people from their homes and left hundreds of injured behind. Hospitals across the region must prepare for an increased number of seriously injured patients.
A warehouse full of fireworks exploded in the city port, setting nearby buildings on fire and seriously injuring hundreds of people. Emergency services are transporting wounded to local hospitals.
Large arteries damaged
Some larger arteries are damaged and may cause life-threatening complications.
Hypoxia
Hypoxia refers to a condition when blood oxygen levels drop.
Hypothermia
Hypothermia refers to a condition when body core temperature drops significantly.
Foreign object present
Foreign object or its parts are still present in the wound and may lead to serious complications.
Liver damaged
Serious internal damage to the liver may cause life-threatening complications.
Spleen damaged
Serious internal damage to the spleen may cause life-threatening complications.
Lungs perforated
Perforation of the lung membranes and tissue.
Pancreas damaged
Serious internal damage to the pancreatic tissue may cause life-threatening complications.
Kidney damaged
Serious internal damage to the kidney tissue may cause life-threatening complications.
Stomach perforated
Perforation of the stomach may cause life-threatening complications.
Small intestine perforated
Serious perforation of the small intestine may cause life-threatening complications.
Large intestine perforated
Serious perforation of the large intestine may cause life-threatening complications.
Tibial fracture
Broken tibial bone - major calf bone.
Femoral fracture
Broken femoral bone - thigh-bone.
Ulnar fracture
Broken ulnar bone - one of the two bones located in a forearm.
Radial fracture
Broken radial bone - one of the two bones located in a forearm.
Humeral fracture
Broken humerus - located in shoulder part of arm.
Fragmented ribs
Fragmented and/or broken rib-bones.
Blisters
A small pocket of fluid in the space between upper layer of the skin (epidermis) and layers beneath, most often caused by skin being damaged by friction or heat.
Desquamation
Also known as peeling skin is shedding of the outermost layer of the skin.
Dark skin
Abnormal darkening of the skin.
Necrosis
Premature death of a tissue caused by its own enzymes. It occurs when too little blood flows to the tissue. This can be cause by an injury, radiation, or chemicals. Necrosis cannot be reversed.
Gunshot wound
Entry or entry-and-exit wound caused by a projectile shot from a firearm.
Ballistic wound
Entry-and-exit or an entry wound caused by a projectile.
Stab wound
Wound caused by stabbing.
Penetrating wound
Wound caused by penetration of a foreign object.
Blast wound
Wound or wounds caused by an explosion.
Burn wound
A burn wound caused by heat, cold, electricity, chemicals, friction, or radiation, affects skin or other tissues.
Pulmonary laceration
Hepatosplenic laceration
Occurs when an object pierces the body and tears the liver and the spleen simultaneously.
Splenopancreatic laceration
Occurs when an object pierces the body and tears the pancreas and the spleen simultaneously.
Upper abdomen gunshot
Physical trauma caused by a bullet from a firearm - penetrating in patient's upper abdomen.
Abdominal ballistic wound
Ballistic trauma caused by high-velocity flying projectile ending up with complex skeletal, vascular, and nerve injuries with large soft tissue defects - affecting patient's abdomen.
Thoracic gunshot
Physical trauma caused by a bullet from a firearm penetrating patient's thorax.
Neck ballistic wound
Ballistic trauma caused by a high-velocity flying projectile resulting in complex skeletal, vascular and nerve injuries with large soft tissue defects affecting patient's neck area.
Arm ballistic wound
Ballistic trauma caused by a high-velocity flying projectile resulting in complex skeletal, vascular and nerve injuries with large soft tissue defects affecting patient's upper limb.
Leg ballistic wound
Ballistic trauma caused by a high-velocity flying projectile resulting in complex skeletal, vascular and nerve injuries with large soft tissue defects affecting patient's lower limb.
Abdominal shattered wound
Polytraumatic penetration of an object that pierces the skin and enters the body, with heavy damage to all neighboring structures and organs.
Abdominal stab wound
Stab wound is a specific form of penetrating trauma to the skin that results from a knife or a similar pointed object.
Thoracic stab wound
Stab wound is a specific form of penetrating trauma to the skin that results from a knife or a similar pointed object.
Neck shattered wound
Polytraumatic penetration of an object that pierces the skin and enters the body, with heavy damage to all neighboring structures and organs.
Arm shattered wound
Polytraumatic penetration of an object that pierces the skin and enters the body, with heavy damage to all neighboring structures and organs.
Leg shattered wound
Polytraumatic penetration of an object that pierces the skin and enters the body, with heavy damage to all neighboring structures and organs.
Abdominal blast trauma
Blast injury is a complex type of physical trauma resulting from direct or indirect exposure to an explosion.
Thoracic blast trauma
Blast injury is a complex type of physical trauma resulting from direct or indirect exposure to an explosion.
Mild frostbite on hands
Frostbite is a potentially serious injury caused by exposing parts of the body to freezing temperatures.
Severe frostbite on hands
Frostbite is a potentially serious injury caused by exposing parts of the body to freezing temperatures.
Mild frostbite on legs
Frostbite is a potentially serious injury caused by exposing parts of the body to freezing temperatures.
Severe frostbite on legs
Frostbite is a potentially serious injury caused by exposing parts of the body to freezing temperatures.
Chemical burn of an arm
Chemical burn caused by contact with acid, base or oxidizer that can cause extensive tissue damage.
Chemical burn of the torso
Chemical burn caused by contact with acid, base or oxidizer that can cause extensive tissue damage.
Struck by lightning
A rare injury caused by direct or indirect hit by a lightning strike.
High voltage burn
Electrical burn is a result of electricity passing through the body. Unlike visible thermal or chemical burns it causes more sub-dermal damage.
Low voltage burn
Electrical burn is a result of electricity passing through the body. Unlike visible thermal or chemical burns it causes more sub-dermal damage.
Radiation dermatitis
Radiation dermatitis, also known as X-ray dermatitis, is a side effect of radiation therapy.
Microwave burn
Burn injury caused by microwave radiation. Unlike other radiation burns, microwave radiation damage is caused by heat.
Thermal burn of an arm
Thermal burns are caused by contact with a heated object or a liquid.
Thermal burn of a leg
Thermal burns are caused by contact with a heated object or a liquid.
Severe thermal burn
Thermal burns are caused by contact with a heated object or a liquid.
Sunburn
Red painful skin that appears after overexposure to the ultraviolet light either from sunshine or from artificial sources.
Venomous spider bite
Bites of venomous spiders create tiny red bumps that are sometimes painful and itchy. The injected poison can also cause more severe symptoms.
Rattlesnake bite
Snakebites typically have two puncture wounds from the fangs. Identification of the snake species and providing the correct antivenom is an urgent task.
Copperhead snake bite
Snakebites typically have two puncture wounds from the fangs. Identification of the snake species and providing the correct antivenom is an urgent task.
Pulmonary laceration
Penetrating trauma caused serious damage to patient's lungs.
Liver and spleen lacerated
Patient's liver and spleen are seriously damaged.
Spleen and pancreas lacerated
Patient's pancreas and spleen are seriously damaged.
Upper abdomen cavitation
Gunshot wound in patient's upper abdomen area with damaged tissue, a cavity created by the passing projectile and a high risk of damage to other organs.
Lower abdomen cavitation
High-velocity projectile wound in patient's lower abdomen area with damaged tissue, a cavity created by the passing projectile and a high risk of damage to other organs.
Chest cavitation
Gunshot wound in patient's chest area with damaged tissue, a cavity created by the passing projectile and a high risk of damage to other organs.
Neck cavitation
High-velocity projectile wound in patient's neck area with damaged tissue, a cavity created by the passing projectile and a high risk of damage to other structures.
Upper limb cavitation
High-velocity projectile wound at patient's upper limb with damaged tissue, a cavity created by the passing projectile and a high risk of damage to other structures.
Lower limb cavitation
High-velocity projectile wound at patient's lower limb with damaged tissue, a cavity created by the passing projectile and a high risk of damage to other structures.
Upper abdomen trauma
Penetrating wound in patient's upper abdomen area with a high risk of more organs and structures damaged.
Lower abdomen trauma
Stab wound in patient's lower abdomen area with a high risk of more organs and structures damaged.
Chest trauma
Stab wound in patient's chest area with a high risk of more organs and structures damaged.
Neck trauma
Penetrating wound in patient's neck area with a high risk of more structures damaged.
Upper limb trauma
Penetration wound at patient's upper limb with a high risk of more structures damaged.
Lower limb trauma
Penetration wound at patient's lower limb with a high risk of more structures damaged.
Abdominal trauma
The patient suffered explosion that was directed towards his/her abdomen.
Chest trauma
Patient's chest was been hit by an explosion that caused a massive damage.
Mild frostbite on hands
Mild form of frostbite localized on patient's hands.
Severe frostbite on hands
Severe form of frostbite localized on patient's hands.
Mild frostbite on legs
Mild form of frostbite localized on patient's legs.
Severe frostbite on legs
Severe form of frostbite localized on patient's legs.
Chemical burn on an arm
Burn wound caused by exposure to aggressive chemicals, localized on patient's arm.
Chemical burn on torso
Burn wound caused by exposure to aggressive chemicals, localized on patient's torso.
Lightning caused lesions
Skin lesions caused by a to direct hit of a lightning.
Sub-dermal tissue damaged
Sub-dermal (beneath the outer layer of the skin) tissue is damaged.
Pigmentation changes
Severe pigmentation changes discovered.
Skin and fat tissue damaged
Skin and fat tissue between burnt and unburnt area shows up tissue sparing.
Thermal burn on an arm
Signs of thermal burn localized on patient's arm.
Thermal burn on a leg
Signs of thermal burn localized on patient's leg.
Severe thermal burn
Signs of severe thermal burn.
Low voltage burn
Burn wound caused by exposure to low voltage electricity.
Sun-burnt skin
Skin tissue burnt by long exposure to direct sunlight.
Black widow bite
Bite of a venomous spider.
Rattlesnake bite
Bite of a venomous snake.
Copperhead snake bite
Bite of a venomous snake.
Antivenom
A treatment using antibodies that bind to and neutralize a specific venom. \n\nRequired room: Office/Diagnostic unit at Traumatology dpt / ICU
Concentrated oxygen
Therapy based on breathing concentrated oxygen. \n\nRequired room: Office/Diagnostic unit / Burn unit at Traumatology dpt. / ICU / Trauma center at Emergency
Warmed IV fluids
Intravenous fluids warmed up to a temperature of 38-45°C/100-113°F used to manage hypothermia. \n\nRequired room: Burn unit at Traumatology dpt. / ICU
Protective dressing
Bandage protective dressing. \n\nRequired room: Office/Diagnostic unit / Burn unit at Traumatology dpt. / ICU / Trauma center at Emergency
Debridement
Medical removal of death tissue. \n\nRequired room: Office/Diagnostic unit / Burn unit at Traumatology dpt. / ICU / Trauma center at Emergency
Burn management
Medical procedure to cure various types of burns. \n\nRequired room: Office/Diagnostic unit/ Burn unit at Traumatology dpt. / ICU / Trauma center at Emergency
Splenectomy
Surgical procedure to remove damaged or disrupted spleen. \n\nRequired room: Operating room at Traumatology + ICU
Hepatoplasty
Surgical procedure that treats liver or its part. \n\nRequired room: Operating room at Traumatology + ICU
Gastric perforation repair
Surgical procedure to seal perforations in the stomach. \n\nRequired room: Operating room at Traumatology + ICU
Small bowel resection
Surgical procedure that removes a part of small intestine. \n\nRequired room: Operating room at Traumatology + ICU
Bowel resection
Surgical procedure that removes a small part of large intestine. \n\nRequired room: Operating room at Traumatology + ICU
Pancreaticoplasty
Surgical procedure that treats the pancreas or its part. \n\nRequired room: Operating room at Traumatology + ICU
Thoracic trauma surgery
Upper limb trauma surgery
Lower limb trauma surgery
Trauma surgery for patients with acute, life-threatening or potentially life-threatening surgical conditions. \n\nRequired room: Operating room at Traumatology + ICU
Laparoscopic pyeloplasty
Minimally invasive surgical procedure that treats kidneys. \n\nRequired room: Operating room at Traumatology + ICU
Trauma fracture surgery - arm
Traumatology surgical procedure that fixes broken bones. \n\nRequired room: Operating room at Traumatology + ICU
Trauma fracture surgery - leg
Traumatology surgical procedure that fixes broken bones. \n\nRequired room: Operating room at Traumatology + ICU
Trauma fracture surgery - thorax
Traumatology surgical procedure that fixes broken bones. \n\nRequired room: Operating room at Traumatology + ICU
Vascular surgery
Surgical procedure to sew and fix damaged arteries. \n\nRequired room: Operating room at Traumatology + ICU
Pulmonary surgery
Pulmonary or lung surgery is surgery done to repair or remove parts of damaged lung tissue. \n\nRequired room: Operating room at Traumatology + ICU

A procedure where the fundus/retina is visualised through a funduscope/opthalmoscope. \n\nRequired room: Doctor's office / Observation room / Trauma center / ICU / Office/Diagnostic unit at Emergency / ICU / Internal Medicine dpt / Neurology dpt / Traumatology dpt

Drugs usually given intravenously or as pills to suppress abnormal rhythms of the heart. \n\nRequired room: ICU / Any office / Diagnostic unit at Emergency dpt / General Surgery dpt / Internal Medicine dpt / Neurology dpt / Traumatology dpt
Procedure to sew muscles and skin. \n\nRequired room: Doctor's office / Observation room / Trauma center / ICU / Office/Diagnostic unit at Orthopaedy dpt / Traumatology dpt
A drug used in the treatment of hypertension. \n\nRequired room: Any office / Diagnostic unit at all departments except Emergency and Infectious diseases dpt

Allergy treating drugs, opposing the activity of histamine receptors, that are responsible for the symptoms of allergy. \n\nRequired room: Doctor's office / Observation room / ICU / Office/Diagnostic unit at General Surgery dpt / Internal Medicine dpt / Neurology dpt / Traumatology dpt
Traumatology: Big hospital
ProtectCare
